Reviews.Title: No Internet.
Reviews.Author: Oscar
Reviews.Content: This is an unknown phone for AT&T; network. The costumer service representative said their system doen't recognizes the IMEI. Therefore, no internet access.

Reviews.Title: cell phone
Reviews.Author: colleen
Reviews.Content: good phone. just not what we are looking for.nice size.its a very bright good color and a nice shape to

Reviews.Title: Blu Samba JR
Reviews.Author: Julia
Reviews.Content: This is  a very basic phone, if this is what your looking for or a temorary phone this is a good pick. You don't have backgrounds to choose from or ringtones, probably 3 total! The phone does not Vibrate on silent. Just to throw that out there.

Reviews.Title: Nice little phone...
Reviews.Author: H Holmes
Reviews.Content: I've had the phone for a couple days, and I do enjoy using it, yet there are some grievances I have with it. I can't seem to figure out how to set my own videos as the Power On/Off animations, nor do I know what kind of video files it needs; the manual is thin, barely covers any specs or features, and is primarily in Spanish, and the only information I can seem to gather on it is what's posted on the description here on Amazon and in the comments here. The FM Radio is very good quality--it picked up on stations that all other radio devices I own garble and/or don't receive at all. The menu and controls are a bit odd and difficult to get used to, and as far as I know, you can't set different ringtones for different contacts, nor can you add more fields for contacts. In addition to this, some of the photos I have aren't displayed or able to be set as they are "too large", so to set your own background you'll need to crop or resize the photos to the pixels the screen can support (which, I haven't figured out yet. It seems 300 works horizontally). The camera isn't that good, either, but it does allow the option, when plugged in, to be used as a webcam, which is a nifty feature.TL;DR, I haven't had it long enough to say I'd buy it again, but for the price it is, I would. It's a good phone, but not a great one.

Reviews.Title: functional phone for children although not bring games
Reviews.Author: Aguilar Heidi
Reviews.Content: Most basic of which apparently described. poor camera. Excellent the battery life. functional phone for children although not bring games

Reviews.Title: great little phone
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: This little phone was a blessing for our trip to Jamaica.  was able to get a Digicel SIm card plug it in and go! This has even been used by many others traveling and it was very reasonable price.  It served it's purpose of a second phone.  Did not need any bells and whistles just wanted to make calls and it did just that!  Very Happy!

Reviews.Title: Cute, functional, practical
Reviews.Author: Felonia
Reviews.Content: Firstly, this phone is itty-bitty - which I think is nice. It's lighter than my former slide-out-keyboard phone, while still having the same qwerty functionality. The small keyboard may indeed be a problem for those with large clumsy fingers, perhaps even for those with very short nails. It's fine for me.I have T-mobile service and it works well. I do not use the internet feature, though.The English portion of the manual starts at ~2/3 through the booklet.I very much like that this phone has a media player and a headphone jack. The sound is better than I expected.What I do love about this phone is that I can plug it into a computer and easily access the files. I don't need a separate card reader for the micro SD, as I've dealt with before. Micro USB cables are wonderful in general (cheap and easy to find/share), but especially on a phone that will actually communicate with a computer.Also important to note, you can alter whether or not your phone vibrates and/or rings by going to the "customize" option in user profiles.One reviewer claimed that this worked as a webcam for him - I do not share that experience. I do have linux, and that may be the issue, but this phone does not make the claim to be a webcam.I haven't used the dual-sim feature, but I very much like having it. I can foresee situations in which it's handy, especially since I hang out with a few people with unreliable phones.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: milton1987
Reviews.Content: very basic phone but easy to use. has two sim card spots which ive never had before and it says my sim memory is smaller than it really is but after I got used to that it's a good phone.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Kara Dupont "Mrs. Edward Anthony"
Reviews.Content: This phone is perfect! I can't go a day without it. I showed it to everyone in my family and they love it!

Reviews.Title: Horrible product
Reviews.Author: Andrea
Reviews.Content: There are limited settings features. Doesn't receive picture messages or take photos as advertised. I purchased 3 of these phones at the same time and all 3 are junk. Complete waste of money!

Reviews.Title: Phone!
Reviews.Author: HManess
Reviews.Content: I did not like this phone! However nothing was wrong with it, it worked just great and was exactly what the seller said. It was just too simple and aggravating having to buy the sim card to put in it!

ProductInfo.Features:
This unlocked cell phone is compatible with GSM carriers like AT&T; and T-Mobile. Not all carrier features may be supported. It will not work with CDMA carriers like Verizon Wireless, Alltel and Sprint.
Unlocked Quad-Band GSM cell phone compatible with 850/900/1800/1900 MHz frequencies (Both SIMs) plus GPRS/WAP data capabilities.
1.3MP Camera; QWERTY Keyboard; Social Networking Integration; Stereo FM radio; MP3 player; MP3 ringtones and MicroSD slot upgradeable up to 8 GB.
Games; Browser WAP 2.0/xHTML; SMS; MMS; Organizer; GPRS Class 10 (4+1/3+2 slots), 32 - 48 kbps; Internal Memory 64 MB + 32 MB and MicroUSB v2.0.
Talk time up to 3 hrs - Stand-by up to 168 hrs.
ProductInfo.Name: BLU Q53-MAG Samba JR Unlocked Dual SIM Quad-Band GSM Phone with 1.3MP Camera, QWERTY Keypad, FM Radio/MP3 Player - US Warranty - Magenta
